article:
When Zoe talks about her dog, Hatti, a big smile always appears on her face. Zoe is thirteen and she was born  _  a terrible illness  . The illness stops her from  growing up  like other children. In 2006, Hatti came to her.
"I wanted a _  of my own to help not just me but all my family. So I called Dogs for the Disabled, an organization which helps the disabled by  _ dogs for them. Things became different after Hatti arrived. It's very _ . It can get many things for me, so my mom doesn't need to be around me all the time. If I need my mom, it can get my mom in a _ -- even in the midnight," said Zoe.
"Hatti is my best friend, and it is  _  to have it around. I think it makes me laugh every day. I used to be scared  _  I was alone, but now Hatti can always stay with me," said Zoe.
Zoe's mom Helen  _ ,"The longer Zoe and Hatti are together, the happier Zoe becomes. She's becoming more independent  . I'm  _ glad and I thank Dogs for the Disabled very much."
